intro: Gonzalagunia secunda, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical in shape, and it produces clusters of small, fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and blooms.
